greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Stolarsky representation interpreted as binary to decimal integers.
comment: See explanation of Stolarksy representations in the C. Mongoven link.
link: C. Mongoven, Description of Stolarsky Representations
example: The Stolarsky representation of 19 is 11101. In binary this is equal to 29. So a(19) = 29.
program: (PARI) a(n) = {if (n == 1, return (0)); tau = (1 + sqrt(5))/2; mn = 0; while ((m = round(mn*tau)) < n, mn++;); if (m == n, return (2*a(mn)+1)); mn = 0; while ((m = floor(mn*(1+tau)-tau/2)) < n, mn++;); if (m == n, return (2*a(mn))); error("neither A nor B !!");} \\ (cf C. Mongoven link) _Michel Marcus_, May 21 2013, Sep 02 2013
results.author: _Casey Mongoven_, Nov 20 2011
